results.title: The Young volunteers
results.creator_credit: Overseas Film & Television Centre and Peter Whale
results.brief_description: British Voluntary Service Overseas: shows orientation process for volunteers at a South London Teachers College. Includes scenes of volunteers in Mauritus, Lima (Peru), Korea, Malaysia, Kuala Lumpur, Tanzania.

results.title: The Young traveller in London
results.creator_credit: H Caspirius, INCA, Phoenix Films and Egon Larsen
results.brief_description: A young girl from the Scottish Highlands visits London for the first time, invited by her relatives. She expects to be shown round by them but discovers that they cannot agree on what to show her - for London means something different to them all; finally, as the film shows, she is taken on three separate trips.

results.title: The Young swimmer: the crawl stroke
results.brief_description: A demonstration of the fundamental principles pf the crawl stroke. A troop of championships swimmers demonstrates in turn the various aspects of the stroke - the attainment of balance by combined leg and arm movement; the correct leg action, observed from above, and below the water surface; breathing; arm action, the thumb entering the water first; co-ordinations of all movement; and the turn.

results.title: The Young protectors
results.brief_description: The Napier boys, interested in nature and wild life, make journeys to the bush and the coast, and walk to cape Kidnapers where they make surveys of the world’s only mainland gannet colony.

results.title: The Young poisoner's handbook
results.creator_credit: Sam Taylor, Mass Productions, Sam Taylor Productions and Benjamin Ross
results.brief_description: 14 year old Graham’s experience with a failed science experiment leads him into a life long obsession with poisons and their effect on those around him. Failing to do away with his first victim - his best friend - Graham charts the slow demise of his step-mother, in the interim maiming his older sister. Once the young poisoner’s crimes are discovered, he is detained in a centre for the criminally insane. From this point on Graham’s battle with redemption and the desire for infamy are followed with dark humour. Deemed to be beyond his unfortunate psychopathic beginnings, Graham finds life outside of ‘Harshurst’ all too seductive for a young poisoner to bare, his new colleagues coming to this realisation just a little too late. Based on the true story of the St Alban’s poisoner.

results.title: The Young person's guide to the orchestra
results.brief_description: This video focuses on the unique qualities of each instrument from it’s creation by the manufacturer to the musician who skilfully channels its sound. Narration by conductor Andrew Davis and interviews with world-acclaimed musicians, such as Yo-Yo Ma, provide insight and flavour to describe the instruments and their role in the sound of the orchestra. Suitable for Primary and Secondary level students.

results.title: The Young ones
results.creator_credit: Kenneth Harper, Associated British Picture Corporation and Sidney J. Furie
results.brief_description: The 1960’s saw a proliferation of teenage dance music films from both the United Kingdom and United States when Elvis and Beatlemania were at their height. Cliff Richard’s film “The Young ones” is a prime example of this genre, and was the first film to have three hits in the Top Ten of the charts. Convinced that a club for teenagers is really a den of Beatnik iniquity, a property tycoon makes preparations to tear it down. Cliff and his friends stage a teen musical to try and save the club and prove that good clean fun and dancing is all they want. Co-starring Robert Morley, Carole Gray and the talented band The Shadows.

results.title: The Young lions
results.creator_credit: Al Lightman, Edward Dmytryk and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The Young Lions depicts the individual men and women on both sides of World War II. On the American side, two men struggle to endure the hardships of Boot Camp and the struggle to reclaim France. On the German side, a dedicated officer goes from the victories of the early years to the despair of defeat. Inevitably, the two sides are drawn together for the showdown. Marlon Brando dominates the film as the young German idealist who embraces Nazism but later comes to doubt it. The film also stars Montgomery Clift, Dean Martin, Hope Lange, Barbara Rush and May Britt. Based on the novel by Irwin Shaw.

results.title: The Young girls of Rochefort = Les Demoiselles de Rochefort
results.creator_credit: Mag Bodard, Cine-Tamaris and Jacques Demy
results.brief_description: Jacques Demy (best known for his earlier film “The Umbrellas of Cherbourg”) weaves a criss-cross tale of romantic thrill and extravagant dance numbers. Catherine Deneuve and real life sister Francoise Dorleac play twins Delphine and Solange, tired of living in the small town Rochefort. Delphine a dancer, and Solange a composer, dream of moving to Paris where they hope to find success, and most importantly, love. Unbeknownst to them their true loves can be found in the very town they live in. Colourful and romantic, “The Young girls of Rochefort’ is a homage to the American musical, with charismatic and charming performances to support the two leads - Gene Kelly plays the American composer Solange falls in love at first sight with, and George Chakiris (best known as Chino in “West Side story”) plays a flirtatious carny. Lyrics are written by Jacques Demy and music is by long term collaborator Michel Legrand. Cast also includes Michel Piccoli, Jacques Perrin, and French screen legend Danielle Darrieux. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Young directors
results.creator_credit: Beaumaris Film Productions and Peter Drummond
results.brief_description: This film looks at the way various young film makers in Australia are adapting film to communicate their ideas. A film about films, it mirrors the distinctive style of student films, cutting quickly, moving rapidly over a wide range of activities and places, contrasting different approaches to film study. Thirteen schools from five States were selected as being representative of filmmaking in Australian schools.
